game.grid

Class Ship

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.grid.Ship

  • public final class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for maintaining the details of each ship. Required for having multi-tile ships.
    Author:
    blackk100

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean direction
      A boolean indicating the orientation of the ship.
      private int[] end
      2 Values indicating the end coordinates.
      private boolean[] hit
      A boolean array indicating whether or not each individual tile the ship is located on was hitor not.
      int length
      A positive integer indicating length of the ship (distance between start and end points).
      private int[] start
      2 Values indicating the start coordinates.
      private boolean sunk
      A boolean indicating whether or not the ship has been sunk.

    • Field Detail

      • length

        public final int length
        A positive integer indicating length of the ship (distance between start and end points).

      • direction

        private boolean direction
        A boolean indicating the orientation of the ship. 
         true  - Vertical
 false - Horizontal

      • start

        private int[] start
        2 Values indicating the start coordinates. 1st value is X-Coordinate. 2nd is Y-Coordinate. It's coordinate values are always less than/equal to end's.

      • end

        private int[] end
        2 Values indicating the end coordinates. 1st value is X-Coordinate. 2nd is Y-Coordinate. It's coordinate values are always greater than/equal to start's.

      • hit

        private boolean[] hit
        A boolean array indicating whether or not each individual tile the ship is located on was hitor not. 
         true  - Hit
 false - Not Hit

      • sunk

        private boolean sunk
        A boolean indicating whether or not the ship has been sunk. Is true if all values in sections are true.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ship

        public Ship(int length)
        Constructor for the Ship class.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the ship.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(int[] coordinates,
                boolean direction)
        Sets the starting and the ending coordinates of the ship.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The starting coordinates (1st value is X-Coordinate, 2nd is Y-Coordinate).
        direction - The orientation of the ship.

      • remove

        public void remove()
        "Removes" the ship from the game board

      • isPlaced

        public boolean isPlaced()
        Returns:
        whether the ship was placed or not.

      • getStart

        public int[] getStart()
        Returns the Start coordinates.
        Returns:
        start 1st value is X-Coordinate. 2nd is Y-Coordinate.

      • getEnd

        public int[] getEnd()
        Returns the End coordinates.
        Returns:
        end 1st value is X-Coordinate. 2nd is Y-Coordinate.

      • getDirection

        public boolean getDirection()
        Returns the orientation of the ship. True if Vertical. False if Horizontal.
        Returns:
        the direction

      • isSunk

        public boolean isSunk()
        Checks if the ship has been sunk.
        Returns:
        true if sunk, else false.

      • sectionHit

        public void sectionHit(int[] coords)
        Marks the given position as hit. Also checks if the ship was sunk.
        Parameters:
        coords - The coordinates at which the ship was hit. 1st value is X-Coordinate, 2nd is Y-Coordinate

      • isHit

        public boolean isHit(int[] coords)
        Checks if the given position was hit,
        Parameters:
        coords - The coordinates to check. 1st value is X-Coordinate, 2nd is Y-Coordinate
        Returns:
        true if hit, else false.

      • isHit

        public boolean isHit(int position)
        Checks if the given position was hit,
        Parameters:
        position - the position to check, with the 1st position being equal to 0.
        Returns:
        true if hit, else false.

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition(int[] coords)
        Gives the given coordinates position relative to the start coordinate of the ship. Returns -1 if not part of the ship.
        Parameters:
        coords - The coordinates to resolve. 1st value is X-Coordinate, 2nd is Y-Coordinate
        Returns:
        an integer giving the relative position of the coordinates. If -1, the coordinates aren't part of the ship.
